crimm.Fetchers

Functions

fetch_alphafold(uniprot_id[, first_model_only])

Get a structure from the alphafold database for a given uniprot id

fetch_alphafold_from_chain(chain)

Find the alphafold structure for a given chain.

fetch_rcsb(pdb_id[, local_entry, ...])

Get a structure from rcsb with a pdb id or from a local mmcif file :param pdb_id: The pdb id of the structure to fetch :type pdb_id: str :param local_entry: The path to the local mmcif file entry point if the PDB archive is downloaded. :type local_entry: str :param first_model_only: Whether to return only the first model of the structure. Otherwise, the structure level entity will be returned :type first_model_only: bool :param use_bio_assembly: Whether to use the bio assembly of the structure. See this article for more info for biological assembly: https://pdb101.rcsb.org/learn/guide-to-understanding-pdb-data/biological-assemblies :type use_bio_assembly: bool :param include_solvent: Whether to include solvent in the structure. :type include_solvent: bool :param include_hydrogens: Whether to include hydrogens in the structure if they exist. :type include_hydrogens: bool :param organize: Whether to return an organized model where the chains are identified and grouped by their chain types. This is useful for generating topology defined by CHARMM force field. Only takes effect if first_model_only is True :type organize: bool :param rename_charmm_ions: Whether to rename ions in the structure to CHARMM ion name defined in water_ions.str. This only takes effect if organize is True :type rename_charmm_ions: bool :param rename_solvent_oxygen: Whether to rename solvent oxygen to CHARMM :type rename_solvent_oxygen: bool :param name "OH2" in the crystallographic water. Doing so will allow crimm to: generate topology definitions on the water. This only takeseffect if organize is True.

fetch_rcsb_as_dict(pdb_id)

Get info about a pdb entry as a dictionary from rcsb

fetch_swiss_model(uniprot_id[, first_model_only])

Get the first matching stucuture from the Swiss Model database for a given uniprot id

fetch_swiss_model_from_chain(chain)

Find the Swiss Model structure for a given chain.

fetch_swiss_model_multiple(uniprot_id[, ...])

Get all stucutures from the Swiss Model database for a given uniprot id
